content:
As an AI language model, I cannot predict the future, but it's important to note that while the goal of the motorsport industry is to eliminate accidents, the risk of accidents can never be fully eliminated. Motorsport racing will always carry some level of risk, but the industry is nonetheless committed to minimizing those risks as much as possible.

Advancements in safety technology have dramatically reduced the number of serious or fatal accidents that occur each year, but accidents are still possible. This is why safety measures, protocols, and standards are so important for ensuring the continued safety of everyone involved in the sport.

It's also worth noting that accidents can and do happen in all sports, and it's important for athletes and organizers to take steps to minimize those risks while also recognizing that some level of risk will always be present. Overall, motorsport organizations are doing everything they can to improve safety, and as technology and safety measures continue to evolve, we can expect further progress in this area.
